en.purpose:
- Matches stage to treatment options, unlike other classification systems.
- Other heart failure classification systems include Forrester Class and NYHA Class.
- Unlike other classification systems, the ACC/AHA stages include patients at risk for heart failure and corresponding management options.
en.use:
- Patients with known heart failure.
- Patients at risk for heart failure.
en.misuse:
- Developed jointly by the American College of Cardiology (ACC) and American Heart Association (AHA) to complement, but not replace, the more widely-used New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional classification.
- Based on expert consensus.

other_details.references: Hunt, S. A., Baker, D. W., Chin, M. H., Cinquegrani, M. P., Feldman, A. M., Francis, G. S., ... & Noble, R. J. (2001). ACC/AHA guidelines for the evaluation and management of chronic heart failure in the adult: executive summary: A report of the american college of cardiology/american heart association task force on practice guidelines (committee to revise the 1995 guidelines for the evaluation and management of heart failure) developed in collaboration with the international society for heart and lung transplantation endorsed by the heart failure society of america. Journal of the American College of Cardiology, 38(7), 2101-2113.
